title: [QUESTION] Vector reflection potential error.
body:
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/0adc4b8988b379382a09301c401c3fca80cc3323/binding/Binding/MathTypes.cs#L78

When calculating the reflection of a vector, shouldn't the dot product be between the vector and the noramlized one? Like this: 

`var dot = point.x * normal.x + point.y * normal.y`

Let's say we have a vector with coordinates `10,10` and we have a normalized vector with coordinates `0,1`, by using this method to calculate the reflection we get a vector with coordinates `10, -390` which is kind of weird in my opinion, maybe I am wrong.
